j713.text:
Spinners are a bit different from normal widgets. They are constructed widgets but their components cannot be separated like in counters for example.
They are built using 3 layers (background, spinner, and value) hosted in a parent layer. (See examples on the right)

   Like in other widgets, the CSS property is applicable, but the spinner has 3 additional CSS properties that allow you to customize each of its layers

   Each layer also has one value property associated with it. "Options" provides an array with which the SVG used on the background is constructed, "angle" is used to set the rotations of the spinner layer, and "value" holds the result of the last spin and is displayed on the value layer.

   In automation, the "value" property can be read and used to get the sum of spinners and organize them.

no0y.text: The 4 layers that construct a spinner are:

zdug.text: - The parent (in red): normally just holds the other layers

pv6x.text: - The backgorund: holds the svg with the options

4nl9.text: - The spinner: holds the svg that will be rotated

s3t7.text: - The value: displays the result from last spin
